  • Constructor Details

    • BoardVisualizer

      public BoardVisualizer(javafx.scene.layout.Pane shipsPane, javafx.scene.layout.Pane enemyShipsPane, double cellSize)

  • Method Details

    • setDebugMode

      public void setDebugMode(boolean enable)

    • drawPlayerBoardGrid

      public void drawPlayerBoardGrid()
      Draws the grid lines and initializes the selection highlight for the player's board. We create a semi-transparent grid overlay and prepare the visual feedback element that shows valid ship placement positions.

    • drawEnemyBoardGrid

      public void drawEnemyBoardGrid()
      Draws the grid lines and initializes the targeting highlight for the enemy's board. We create a semi-transparent grid and a yellow highlight that shows which cell the player is currently targeting for their next attack.

    • restoreVisualShips

      public void restoreVisualShips(Cell[][] enemyBoardCells)
      Reconstructs enemy ship visuals based on a loaded game board. We scan the logical board state and recreate the visual ship representations, ensuring the display matches exactly what was saved in the game file.

    • drawPlayerShipsFromModel

      public void drawPlayerShipsFromModel(Cell[][] boardCells)
      Reconstructs the player's fleet visuals from the logical board state. We use this method when loading a saved game to ensure visual ships match their logical positions, preventing ships from disappearing after load.

    • drawShotResult

      public void drawShotResult(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane, int col, int row, boolean hit)
      Draws visual feedback for a shot result on the game board. We display either a hit marker (red circle with bomb graphic) or a miss marker (gray X) to give players clear feedback on their attacks.

    • markShipAsSunk

      public void markShipAsSunk(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane, Cell[][] board, Ship sunkShip)
      Highlights all cells belonging to a sunk ship with fire effects. We scan the entire board to find every cell occupied by the destroyed ship and overlay fire visuals to emphasize the ship's destruction.

    • getSelectionHighlight

      public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle getSelectionHighlight()

    • getEnemySelectionHighlight

      public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle getEnemySelectionHighlight()
